title: Honey-mustard Swordfish Steaks
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Honey-mustard Swordfish Steaks a try. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 564 calories, 68g of protein, and 23g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 1 and costs $8.07 per serving. It is perfect for valentin day. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. A mixture of honey, evvo, lots coarse-ground pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the honey you could follow this main course with the Honey Gingerbread as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Honey Teriyaki Swordfish Steaks, Bbq Onion Steaks with Honey-Mustard Sauce, and Bbq Onion Steaks With Honey Mustard Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 26 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.
